The given Node.js code is a module that exports an `AbortError` class from a module named `AbortError.js`. It uses the CommonJS module system with `Object.defineProperty` to define the `AbortError` property on the `exports` object. This exported `AbortError` can then be used by other modules that import this one.

Here's a rewritten version of this Node.js code using a modern syntax:

```javascript
"use strict";
// Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation.
// Licensed under the MIT license.

export { AbortError } from './AbortError.js';
```
